content.question: Let <math alttext="g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be a differentiable function such that <math alttext="g of 4, equals, 0.325" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>0.325</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="g prime of x, equals, the fraction 1 over x, end fraction, times e to the negative x power, times, open parenthesis, the cosine of, open parenthesis, x over 100, close parenthesis, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></msup><mo>(</mo><mi>cos</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>100</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>. What is the value of <math alttext="g of 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> ?
